Text:
...I assume you have all the necessary information
in order?
Yes, ma'am!
Yes, ma'am!
Done to perfection.

We shall bring Sergey's massacre of the Herzog
Family to light, put his position as one of the
Seven Blades in jeopardy, and thus force him
to come out and fightâ€”

And by utilizing Annerose's efforts on this front,
everything is in place to conceal all traces of the
Shadow Garden's involvement!

...Although it is a bit of a letdown that we can't
expose the existence of the Cult itself to the
world.

I understand completely, Zeta. To be honest, I feel
the same way.

Nevertheless, it's not yet time to cast light on the
corruption in this world. For now, we must hide
patiently in the shadows, amassing our strength.
Yeah, I know. It was never going to be that easy.

Changing the world would take all the more
groundwork, huh...
Zeta...

So, Gamma, how are you going to pave the way for
Annerose to disclose Sergey's wicked deeds?

Writing articles for the newspaper association will
will be done in support of this plan, you see.

As for Annerose, we will use her to search the Herzog
Family's hidden manor.

If she discovers evidence that Sergey slaughtered
the Herzogs, Annerose will surely report it to the
Empireâ€”

Even if the Cult were to suppress said report using
some behind-the-scenes maneuvering, we would still
achieve our goal of drawing Sergey out!

He will certainly be forced to recognize the existence
of someone pulling the strings from the shadows,
wielding Annerose and her guileless efforts toward
their own ends...namely, us.

And if we're having Annerose search the former home
of the Herzog Family, naturally Sergey is going to do
what he can to interfere, yes?

Correct. I've assigned No. 111 and No. 122 to handle
any such interference.

No. 111 in particular will be the "leading lady"
playing the part of Lady Karen's ghost.

Leading lady... I like it. We need to make sure she
portrays the tragic heroine to the hilt.

I have no objections to your game plan...but can I
add something? It also kinda ties into another
topicâ€”
Is there something else that concerns you?

...So I looked into Sergey's status within the Cult,
and it isn't very good, or rather he pretty much
stands alone.

Pretty much stands alone... Meaning he has no
allies?

He's an upstart Child who rose to sudden prominence
by slaying Stan Bach.

And despite being a newcomer, he took out the
Herzogs, a senior aristocratic family within the
Cult.

So for the cultists who call the shots in Velgalta,
Sergey isn't a guy local insiders envy so much as
he's a loose cannon that could come murder them
in their sleep at any moment.

Him being able to claim a top position out of sheer
strength without any discord... Well, it might as
well be how things work in therianthrope society.

...And he doesn't seem to be in league with factions
in other nations?

Nope. The Fenrir sect in Midgar was trying to
recruit Sergey so they could dig their claws
deeper into Velgalta...

...But it seems talks fell apart and as a result it's
anyone's guess as to who's calling the shots for the
Cult in Velgalta now.

So Sergey disposed of Lady Karen despite knowing
full well the kind of infighting it would trigger?

He did say that he wasn't going to accept the Cult's
table scraps... Perhaps we should think of this as
him providing very real proof that he will act on
his own goals.

...So here's where things get interestingâ€”
the situation in Velgalta has got some other
people poking around.
The Templars.
Correct.

With the Cult being in an uproar in Velgalta, the
Templars can make inroads into their territory in
the Empire and ramp up their hunting of the
possessed...
So the enemy of our enemy...is still an enemy.

I wish that was all, but the jerks that they are, I have
reason to believe that the Templars are keeping tabs
on Sergey.

My guess is they think sniffing around any Cult or
Children-adjacent goings-on will lead them to more
possessed.

...So what you're saying is, worst case scenario, we
may encounter them during this operation...?!

I'd...really prefer not to think of such a dire
outcome.
...Zeta.

As a precaution, can I ask you to join the plan to
lead Annerose to the Herzog manor?

Just in case the Templars catch wind of Sergey going
after Annerose and decide to butt in...and our friend
Victoria makes an appearance, huh?

...Can't have the leading lady's big moment ruined
by a nasty bunch of stage-crashers, now can we?

Okay, I'm on it. I'll lead No. 111 and No. 122 from
the field, too.
Thank you. They'll be in good handsâ€”
